headline: Juan Williams attends 32nd Annual Bark Ball
subHeadline: Dogs get dressed in their best to attend gala.

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everybody. I'm Jesse Watters along with Dr. Nicole Saphier, Juan Williams, Dana Perino, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is "The Five." The Republicans are fed up with Adam Schiff's secret impeachment hearings, and now they're doing something about it. Furious Republican congressmen fought back by storming their way into a close door interview with the latest witness. Republicans also hammering Democrats with a total lack of transparency.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Behind those doors they intend to overturn the results of an American presidential election. What is Adam Schiff trying to hide?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What is happening here is not fair.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There is no reason this should be down in a tiny room within a room within a skiff at the basement of the Capitol. That's so Adam Schiff can control the narrative, can drive polling, and can get the vote that he wants, which is to impeach the president.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All of that is happening while the media eats up the latest talking points spoon fed to them by the Democrats. Check out this press endlessly repeating that the testimony from the top diplomat to the Ukraine was, quote, devastating and clear evidence of a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Up ahead, much more on this devastating day for the Trump administration.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's devastating testimony.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Really devastating piece of evidence.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That's why this testimony today was so devastating.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's devastating. It's a smoking gun.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Devastating from a national security perspective.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: His testimony is devastating.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That sounds like a quid pro quo directed by the president.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Is, in fact, a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: To push for a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: There was, in fact, a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The very clear quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That is a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Not so fast. Republicans in the room say the diplomat crumbled under questioning and there was no evidence of a quid pro quo. Juan, don't you think this would just clear everything up if they just did this in open?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: Right, but it wouldn't be a legitimate process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why not?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because you don't want to libel somebody. What if somebody says something is not true or something --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait, you think it would be illegitimate to hold a hearing in public?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, you didn't ask me that. You said this impeachment inquiry is being done right now in private. In other words, to allow people confidentiality to make statements, and then they can be brought forward. By the way, quid pro quo, how can you not -- did you read what Bill Taylor said? Bill Taylor who's a West Point grad who served in Vietnam, a Bush appointee, ambassador in places like Afghanistan, Ukraine? You think he's a liar?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I read his opening statement, but what we didn't hear is him under cross examination, and that's what I think, Greg, everybody wants to know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, there is no evidence of a quid pro quo. And guess what? We don't even -- we can't even prove that, because you don't even have any people asking questions in public.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Here's his statement. You can read it, Jesse. In the statement --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Anybody can make a statement and anybody can fail to answer a follow up questions which, apparently, he did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You think Taylor is a liar and --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know what he is, Juan. But I know I don't know and you don't either.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, but the press --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- so the press is wrong --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I know that they're calling people in secret and the Democrats are leaking it to the Washington Post.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I can read --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, you, as a journalist, should be ashamed for doing this behind closed doors.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I am proud that the press of the United States of America can report on a legitimate distinguished diplomat's statement --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's all leaks, Juan, and you know it.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I think the thing is the problem with the secret testimony is that nobody should believe it, because it's -- right off the bat it stinks. The way I look at it, all you need to know is you've got to ask yourself a question, you have historically low unemployment, you've got 6.4 million new jobs, a booming economy, so far you have peace and it's contagious, Juan. I'm sorry.  So what does the establishment loser response? A secret anonymously driven coup which is egged on by the media. That -- to your point, that is the thing that I don't understand. There's only one explanation for this. Because of the results of Trump's White House so far, they realize they can't beat him, so they need to eliminate him. So what they're doing is they're willing to divide and create division among our country as a political weapon to solve their political humiliation. I have one question for libertarians, for leftists, true leftists, and pacifist. You now have a president whose primary goal is not spilling anymore blood anywhere, where are you? This is like the most progressive foreign policy I've seen in my life. You're going to let the New York Times, you're going to let Hillary Clinton, you're going to let CNN and Adam Schiff basically replace him with a Hillary pod because they don't like him, after what he's doing? That's pretty fricking crazy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana, what do you think about this? You know, the Washington Post like to say democracy dies in the darkness.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: I think that arguing for transparency is usually is your best argument especially with the media, because we revere the first amendment, right? So the transparency thing is good. The stunt today of going down -- you know the president said I want the Republicans to get tougher, so that -- they'll win the news cycle on that today. Like, they'll be able to drive the news. But when the majority of the House Democrats have the gavel they're not affected by the transparency argument, they just keep rolling down until they see something in their polling, or in their focus groups, or the pressure from their constituents gets to a fever pitch on transparency, they're probably not going to change it. The other thing is, I think -- I feel like the goal posts from both sides are moving so much that even if there was to say -- like there was a quid pro quo, I'm pretty sure it would be like, oh, OK. Fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, who cares?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Who cares?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Who cares? Because that's what people do, Dana, correct?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like, I want you to check -- I want you to check out your corruption before we give you all this money. That's what his job is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But, Greg, it's not -- the quid pro quo here was something for the president, something of value, dirt on his political opponent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The corruption -- no, no, no. You're talking about corruption, 2016 corruption. Look into it. I'm sorry --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, Joe Biden --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also, Juan, there is no quid pro quo because the Ukrainians didn't even know that any of the money was being withheld. Dr. Saphier, I want to play some sound from the Republicans on this and you can react.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The mainstream media reporting that he provided evidence of a quid pro quo involving military aid is false. Neither he or any other witness has provided testimony that the Ukrainians were aware that military aid was being withheld. You can't have a quid pro quo with no quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The truth is, is that in two minutes, John Radcliff destroyed this witness. There's no quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dr. Saphier?

utterances.speaker: NICOLE SAPHIER, HOST
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I find it interesting because, you know, we didn't do the timeline. Either they have the conversation, the phone conversation, Trump and Zelensky in July. And there's reports that the White House is holding back these funding. The funds, themselves, weren't actually going to be us until September, October unless Zelensky made some public declaration, which, by the way, never actually happened. Yet, the funds did go there.  So, you know, I have a lot of questions when it comes to the quid pro quo. You know, unfortunately, the lack of transparency, my questions aren't being answered. Adam Schiff is running such a tight ship with the closed door policy here, yet he's allowing the leaks, he's allowing this narrative to build up full of like inflated verbiage, and I just think it continues to divide the country, and that just seems to be their number one goal right now is massive division for 2020 election. And I'm tired of all this posturing just for election purposes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I think, Juan, after a while, if you're going to continue to do this in the dark, in secret, so the country can know why the president is being impeached, people are going to be fed up with it. I think this is going to do long-term damage here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me get this straight, you don't know why the president is being impeached?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can't have any evidence, even seen by Republicans. They can't even see transcripts. They're actually threatening to withhold checks from people that are testifying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You don't know why the president is being impeached?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You want to see the full evidence, Juan. You want to listen to witness testimony --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's the legitimate constitutional process that they would hold --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You think it's legitimate to do it behind closed doors?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You think this is legitimate, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just told you I do. And the second thing to tell you is that it will come out and then you'll say, oh, my gosh, why are they presenting it this way? This is unfair to the president --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When will it come out, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's gonna come out in a month or so. But certainly -- but let me just say this, it's the Senate that should be worrying you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Because, right now, we see reporting that says -- I think there's a daily caller or somebody -- you know, did a poll of all the people in the Senate. Forget the poll of the American people who think this is legitimate. There were only seven senators who said they're not open to the inquiry, impeaching, and removing --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think it's that point where most Republicans --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana, where do you see this going?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, Schiff will continue to call these witnesses, like -- because everything is so polarized. Each side thinks that they're winning. And there are Republicans that think, absolutely, you impeach Donald Trump -- impeachment does not mean that he's not going to be president anymore. Clinton was impeached and his polling numbers went up. His popularity went up. Probably had a chance to run for a third term, who knows what would happen. I don't know. I'm not saying --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But there are Republicans who truly believe this is helping him. Then there are Democrats who think this -- that they have to do this in order to try to fight back against their base who's frustrated because they want to say how are you holding the president accountable?  In the meantime, especially it's kind of interesting, there's reporting today that Pelosi's team and the Trump White House are still working on their plan is -- whatever you think about the lowering of the drug prices, at least their policy proposal, which I don't think it's great prescription, but they're still moving forward on that. And the trade deal, the USMCA, apparently, is still on track as well. So maybe it's possible that they can actually still get things done and continue with impeachment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you talking about walking and chewing gum at the same time?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a great cliche.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a great analogy. I can't believe I thought of it. Is crooked Hillary about to make a comeback. How close Clinton is to a 2020 rematch with Trump? Up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Are you ready for Hillary 2020? Speculation now mounting Clinton could jump into the race. She's reportedly mulling a rematch with the president after feeling vindicated on her e-mail scandal. The State Department recently found no deliberate mishandling of classified information by Clinton. It also comes amidst reports the party's leaders have serious doubts about the current group of Democratic contenders. Greg, let's start.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know I predicted this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I predicted this -- what -- how many years ago? The problem -- remember, I always said that there's like -- she was always wanting to change the first line of her obituary, right? She doesn't want to be lost to Trump. However, what's missing here -- what's missing here is friendship. Friendship isn't somebody saying, hey, whatever you do I'm going to support you. Friendship says are you nuts. A person comes up and she says she's gonna run, a person would say, stop, let's go to happy hour, let's get a day drunk going. I'll call my guy. He'll meet us at the airport. We'll go to Bora Bora. Forget about this because it's stupid. Here's the thing. She cannot enter the race without being number one. She can't return to the world as a third or fourth banana. That would be like Brad Pitt leaving motion pictures to do the local weather, and pick the city of your choice, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Hmm.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Boise, OK. So the only way for -- Juan, the only way for her to do this is a massive orchestration by the party in which everybody has to stand down, right? She has to be ushered to the front of the line. Bernie ain't going to be her V.P. Joe, that would be hilarious if he became her V.P. Liz ain't gonna do it. So that leaves her with either Mayor Pete or Kamala -- she has -- they have to orchestrate the V.P. choice for her, for all of this to happen. This is worse than the CNN, Bernie -- Bernie, whatchamacallit, remember the debate thing. This is worse than that. It's not happening. It's going to piss off too many people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I must say, so, Dana, here's the thing, I was just looking I've said, where is this coming from? Because I don't see any reality to it when I check with people who are around Hillary Clinton, and they say -- Steve Bannon. Steve Bannon has been on Fox Business promoting this. The New York Post has been promoting this. Drudge had a picture of Hillary in a Halloween witch's hat like, you know, the witch is coming back. The wicked witch of the west. And I think to myself, maybe she's such a villain for the Republicans, they want to beat up on her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Beat up, really, Juan?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that the thing is, she's been on a book tour with her daughter that coincided right now with this process and the timing of it. So, I think, partly, is that just because she's out there and she's commenting not on the -- the book is about successful women in history and all their great stories --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which is why she's not in it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But besides her obituary it's not -- she didn't just lose to Trump, she lost to Obama and Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that is a unique thing. Not everybody can say that. And she doesn't have, as Greg said, people saying, like, OK, stand down. Maybe, perhaps, she's whispering that she still feels like she could beat him. Remember, she thinks she did beat him. She thinks that Facebook got in her way, Russia got in her way. There's no personal responsibility, so she can't move on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, you think so. OK. Jesse, what -- I saw today a poll -- did I miss something?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, I said, yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, yeah, I agree with you. OK. CNN had a poll today, had Biden spiking up now at 34 percent, Warren at 19, Sanders at 16. So Biden is at his highest number since he entered the race, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that is interesting. But here's the thing, why are donors so worried about Trump winning if all the polls, including this latest one, show Trump losing to Biden and Warren and Bernie? It just tells me that you can't trust these polls over a year out. I mean, they had Dukakis beating Reagan. They have Kerry beating Bush. It's way too early. And Hillary loves that they're talking about her now, because she was kind of wasting away now. I mean, now, people are interested in Hillary. People are excited about the possibility of Hillary getting back in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Am I wrong to say that conservatives --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I would say the New York Times reported that donors are asking about Hillary getting into the race because they don't think these guys have what it takes. But here's the thing. She did win the popular vote. She could run against Trump's record, and she wouldn't have a problem raising money. But the other thing is she's still crooked, she matches up terribly against Donald Trump, and the rest of the party isn't really behind her. And like Greg said, it's going to be an absolute mess if she jumps in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That'll be great.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What do you think --

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.sentences: So I'm gonna say, I have to agree with Jesse. Shocking that -- she is still crooked because the State Department came out saying no persuasive evidence of systemic deliberate mishandling of classified info regarding her e-mail, and that is just so specific. So what she's ignorant then? What they did come back they said that there were actually hundreds of security violations --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Five hundred and eighty eight.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.sentences: During her tenure. So, either she's completely ignorant and clueless or she's a terrible leader and just has her underlings do her dirty work for her, which is why she didn't win. And, you know, Buttigieg said it best. He said the reason that she lost is because her whole message was, we have to -- don't vote for him because he's bad. But they're doing the exact same thing over and over again with their impeachment and with just trying to discredit everything that President Trump does. They're falling into their same pattern of don't vote for him, only vote for us because it's not him, They're not really putting forth anything great that's gonna move our country forward again. I personally don't think she's running at all. I think this is all just silly. But, you know, she can't endure the thought of having another woman in the front, in the lead. So I think that -- that is why she continues to try to make herself relevant. She's not gonna run again in my opinion. But I think it just kills her that there's so many women in the field right now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, so something like the USA doctor, the fact the Democrats are saying here's a healthcare plan, Trump has none. Here's -- that doesn't strike you as a Democratic agenda forward looking?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.sentences: Look, everyone has their plan. Whether or not it's actually going to be implement and work in our current society is a completely different thing. I don't care if Elizabeth Warren has a very detailed plan. I think it is nonsense. And I don't think it's gonna work if you implement it in the United States, the latest right now. So, plans mean nothing to me right now. I mean, President Trump had said it himself, I mean, healthcare is complicated.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg takes the hot seat in the Nation Capitol. He's facing intense questioning from Democrats in Congress over the political ad controversy and claims of bias. That's next right here on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Democrats appeared to have a new public enemy for 2020, Facebook's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg. They want him to police the platform more, start censoring political ads including and, especially, from President Trump that they feel could tip the scales in the next election. Democrats going after Zuckerberg today on the Hill.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You plan on doing no fact checking on political ads. MARK ZUCKERBERG, Facebook CEO: We do not fact check politicians speech. And the reason for that is that we believe that in a democracy it is important that people can see for themselves what politicians are saying.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: So you won't take down lies or you will take down lies? I think it's just a pretty, simply, yes or no.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Russia interferes with U.S. elections. You admit it that you were caught on your heels. The question is, what has been and what will be done for 2020?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg, we talked a little bit earlier about if you can't beat the president at one thing, then you want to take away his ability --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- to communicate. Look, Republicans have some problems with Facebook as well. He did a grilling from both sides. But this issue about political speech and who should be in charge of policing was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's also -- to that point about the fact there's a lack of innovation and creation on that side. What a contrast between one person who created something for better or worse that has impacted billions in a phenomenal way, Facebook, and you compare to these Capitol Hill clowns. Ninety percent of these relics need to be briefed on what Facebook is. I've heard Maxine Waters actually thought Facebook was an actual book filled with faces.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Speaking of Maxine, you know, she's there talking about like promoting freedom of speech. This is the extremist who ordered her constituents to mob anyone who might have been sympathetic to Trump. So Facebook isn't the danger here when it comes speech. The growing intensity of the intolerant regressive left is coming from another side, and they're the ones that are beating up people and throwing stuff on politicians. It ain't Facebook or the people who use Facebook or the troll farms that paid a couple of hundred grand.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. The ads that were paid on Facebook were like the fake bots that have been purged. And, Jesse, they say they have new securities in place to make sure that that doesn't happen again. Do you think it's possible that as things start to shift that Silicon Valley might rethink who they align themselves with and support?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Imagine being a genius, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't have to.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Tell what it's like.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And being stuck in the room with a bunch of idiots. This is what that's like? This guy is a certified genius and you have a bunch of idiot politicians with no talent and no brain, as Greg said, berating him like they have any idea what's going on. These politicians should be thanking Mr. Zuckerberg. Thank you, Mr. Zuckerberg, for letting me stay in touch with my family. Thank you for creating millions of jobs, billions of dollars of wealth, revolutionizing the way human beings communicate all over the world. But instead, they're lying and they're whining about, oh, you let Republicans lie? We're the only ones that are supposed to be up in a lie. I mean, come on. How absurd is that? And for Meeks to say, you were caught flat footed on Russia interference. Oh, I think the Obama administration was caught flat footed there, not Facebook.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What's wrong with flat feet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I mean, sometimes people would have a high arch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dr. Nicole, tell us about that

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.sentences: This is an issue --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do I need to wear lips?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.sentences: You should. I mean, I have arches. Here's the thing, I found Maxine Waters to be so snarky with Zuckerberg that I found it just offensive. And this -- she actually said to him, oh, you think you're above the law to Mark Zuckerberg, this genius, and it was just -- I find it very ironic coming from her who had -- I think it was three ethics violations charge brought on her in 2010, subsequently dropped. However, it's just -- I find it -- I find it very despicable the way they've treated this man. Now, you have two different issues when it comes to Facebook, you know, the market power and then his Libra cryptocurrency. You know, I personally have some concerns with the monolithic company with history of security breaches having their own cryptocurrency. However, cryptocurrency is the future. And although, I may not be there quite yet, I can barely even use my iPhone very well, I would love to see a cryptocurrency be this big come out of America as opposed to somewhere else --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: China.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.sentences: Yeah, exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan, do you think the Democrats are going to try to push for regulations to make - try to make Facebook police speech on their platforms or maybe think, do they think that enough public pressure can be brought to bear that they would change their policy?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think Zuckerberg has said that he would like them to do this. That's what he said. That's his statement, Dana. My concern is when I listen to all of you, I think, goodness gracious, we know that Facebook was exploited by the Russians last time. Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They did a terrible job.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We know that the Russians continue to exploit Facebook to divide us by race, by religion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Those are the Democrats, not the Russian.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Come on, Greg. So, in other words, you guys have no problem with that or that politicians are allowed to put lies out, things like that. Pelosi video of her appearing to be drunk when we know it was distorted and wrong, and Nancy Pelosi asked them to take it down. They refused. And yet you guys are like well, no, he's a genius. utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Really devastating piece of evidence.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's why this testimony today was so devastating.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: It's devastating. It's a smoking gun.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Devastating from a national security perspective.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: His testimony is devastating.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: That sounds like a quid pro quo directed by the president.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Is, in fact, a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: To push for a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There was, in fact, a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The very clear quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: That is a quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not so fast. Republicans in the room say the diplomat crumbled under questioning and there was no evidence of a quid pro quo. Juan, don't you think this would just clear everything up if they just did this in open?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: Right, but it wouldn't be a legitimate process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why not?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because you don't want to libel somebody. What if somebody says something is not true or something --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait, you think it would be illegitimate to hold a hearing in public?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, you didn't ask me that. You said this impeachment inquiry is being done right now in private. In other words, to allow people confidentiality to make statements, and then they can be brought forward. By the way, quid pro quo, how can you not -- did you read what Bill Taylor said? Bill Taylor who's a West Point grad who served in Vietnam, a Bush appointee, ambassador in places like Afghanistan, Ukraine? You think he's a liar?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I read his opening statement, but what we didn't hear is him under cross examination, and that's what I think, Greg, everybody wants to know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, there is no evidence of a quid pro quo. And guess what? We don't even -- we can't even prove that, because you don't even have any people asking questions in public.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Here's his statement. You can read it, Jesse. In the statement --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. Anybody can make a statement and anybody can fail to answer a follow up questions which, apparently, he did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You think Taylor is a liar and --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know what he is, Juan. But I know I don't know and you don't either.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, but the press --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- so the press is wrong --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I know that they're calling people in secret and the Democrats are leaking it to the Washington Post.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I can read --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, you, as a journalist, should be ashamed for doing this behind closed doors.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I am proud that the press of the United States of America can report on a legitimate distinguished diplomat's statement --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's all leaks, Juan, and you know it.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: I think the thing is the problem with the secret testimony is that nobody should believe it, because it's -- right off the bat it stinks. The way I look at it, all you need to know is you've got to ask yourself a question, you have historically low unemployment, you've got 6.4 million new jobs, a booming economy, so far you have peace and it's contagious, Juan. I'm sorry. So what does the establishment loser response? A secret anonymously driven coup which is egged on by the media. That -- to your point, that is the thing that I don't understand. There's only one explanation for this. Because of the results of Trump's White House so far, they realize they can't beat him, so they need to eliminate him. So what they're doing is they're willing to divide and create division among our country as a political weapon to solve their political humiliation. I have one question for libertarians, for leftists, true leftists, and pacifist. You now have a president whose primary goal is not spilling anymore blood anywhere, where are you? This is like the most progressive foreign policy I've seen in my life. You're going to let the New York Times, you're going to let Hillary Clinton, you're going to let CNN and Adam Schiff basically replace him with a Hillary pod because they don't like him, after what he's doing? That's pretty fricking crazy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana, what do you think about this? You know, the Washington Post like to say democracy dies in the darkness.

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.utterance: I think that arguing for transparency is usually is your best argument especially with the media, because we revere the first amendment, right? So the transparency thing is good. The stunt today of going down -- you know the president said I want the Republicans to get tougher, so that -- they'll win the news cycle on that today. Like, they'll be able to drive the news. But when the majority of the House Democrats have the gavel they're not affected by the transparency argument, they just keep rolling down until they see something in their polling, or in their focus groups, or the pressure from their constituents gets to a fever pitch on transparency, they're probably not going to change it. The other thing is, I think -- I feel like the goal posts from both sides are moving so much that even if there was to say -- like there was a quid pro quo, I'm pretty sure it would be like, oh, OK. Fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, who cares?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Who cares?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Who cares? Because that's what people do, Dana, correct?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like, I want you to check -- I want you to check out your corruption before we give you all this money. That's what his job is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But, Greg, it's not -- the quid pro quo here was something for the president, something of value, dirt on his political opponent.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The corruption -- no, no, no. You're talking about corruption, 2016 corruption. Look into it. I'm sorry --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, Joe Biden --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also, Juan, there is no quid pro quo because the Ukrainians didn't even know that any of the money was being withheld. Dr. Saphier, I want to play some sound from the Republicans on this and you can react.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The mainstream media reporting that he provided evidence of a quid pro quo involving military aid is false. Neither he or any other witness has provided testimony that the Ukrainians were aware that military aid was being withheld. You can't have a quid pro quo with no quo.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The truth is, is that in two minutes, John Radcliff destroyed this witness. There's no quid pro quo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dr. Saphier?

utterances.speaker: NICOLE SAPHIER, HOST
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I find it interesting because, you know, we didn't do the timeline. Either they have the conversation, the phone conversation, Trump and Zelensky in July. And there's reports that the White House is holding back these funding. The funds, themselves, weren't actually going to be us until September, October unless Zelensky made some public declaration, which, by the way, never actually happened. Yet, the funds did go there. So, you know, I have a lot of questions when it comes to the quid pro quo. You know, unfortunately, the lack of transparency, my questions aren't being answered. Adam Schiff is running such a tight ship with the closed door policy here, yet he's allowing the leaks, he's allowing this narrative to build up full of like inflated verbiage, and I just think it continues to divide the country, and that just seems to be their number one goal right now is massive division for 2020 election. And I'm tired of all this posturing just for election purposes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I think, Juan, after a while, if you're going to continue to do this in the dark, in secret, so the country can know why the president is being impeached, people are going to be fed up with it. I think this is going to do long-term damage here.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me get this straight, you don't know why the president is being impeached?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can't have any evidence, even seen by Republicans. They can't even see transcripts. They're actually threatening to withhold checks from people that are testifying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You don't know why the president is being impeached?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You want to see the full evidence, Juan. You want to listen to witness testimony --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's the legitimate constitutional process that they would hold --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You think it's legitimate to do it behind closed doors?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You think this is legitimate, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I just told you I do. And the second thing to tell you is that it will come out and then you'll say, oh, my gosh, why are they presenting it this way? This is unfair to the president --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: When will it come out, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's gonna come out in a month or so. But certainly -- but let me just say this, it's the Senate that should be worrying you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because, right now, we see reporting that says -- I think there's a daily caller or somebody -- you know, did a poll of all the people in the Senate. Forget the poll of the American people who think this is legitimate. There were only seven senators who said they're not open to the inquiry, impeaching, and removing --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't think it's that point where most Republicans --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dana, where do you see this going?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, Schiff will continue to call these witnesses, like -- because everything is so polarized. Each side thinks that they're winning. And there are Republicans that think, absolutely, you impeach Donald Trump -- impeachment does not mean that he's not going to be president anymore. Clinton was impeached and his polling numbers went up. His popularity went up. Probably had a chance to run for a third term, who knows what would happen. I don't know. I'm not saying --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But there are Republicans who truly believe this is helping him. Then there are Democrats who think this -- that they have to do this in order to try to fight back against their base who's frustrated because they want to say how are you holding the president accountable? In the meantime, especially it's kind of interesting, there's reporting today that Pelosi's team and the Trump White House are still working on their plan is -- whatever you think about the lowering of the drug prices, at least their policy proposal, which I don't think it's great prescription, but they're still moving forward on that. And the trade deal, the USMCA, apparently, is still on track as well. So maybe it's possible that they can actually still get things done and continue with impeachment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Are you talking about walking and chewing gum at the same time?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a great cliche.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a great analogy. I can't believe I thought of it. Is crooked Hillary about to make a comeback. How close Clinton is to a 2020 rematch with Trump? Up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Are you ready for Hillary 2020? Speculation now mounting Clinton could jump into the race. She's reportedly mulling a rematch with the president after feeling vindicated on her e-mail scandal. The State Department recently found no deliberate mishandling of classified information by Clinton. It also comes amidst reports the party's leaders have serious doubts about the current group of Democratic contenders. Greg, let's start.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know I predicted this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I predicted this -- what -- how many years ago? The problem -- remember, I always said that there's like -- she was always wanting to change the first line of her obituary, right? She doesn't want to be lost to Trump. However, what's missing here -- what's missing here is friendship. Friendship isn't somebody saying, hey, whatever you do I'm going to support you. Friendship says are you nuts. A person comes up and she says she's gonna run, a person would say, stop, let's go to happy hour, let's get a day drunk going. I'll call my guy. He'll meet us at the airport. We'll go to Bora Bora. Forget about this because it's stupid. Here's the thing. She cannot enter the race without being number one. She can't return to the world as a third or fourth banana. That would be like Brad Pitt leaving motion pictures to do the local weather, and pick the city of your choice, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Hmm.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Boise, OK. So the only way for -- Juan, the only way for her to do this is a massive orchestration by the party in which everybody has to stand down, right? She has to be ushered to the front of the line. Bernie ain't going to be her V.P. Joe, that would be hilarious if he became her V.P. Liz ain't gonna do it. So that leaves her with either Mayor Pete or Kamala -- she has -- they have to orchestrate the V.P. choice for her, for all of this to happen. This is worse than the CNN, Bernie -- Bernie, whatchamacallit, remember the debate thing. This is worse than that. It's not happening. It's going to piss off too many people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I must say, so, Dana, here's the thing, I was just looking I've said, where is this coming from? Because I don't see any reality to it when I check with people who are around Hillary Clinton, and they say -- Steve Bannon. Steve Bannon has been on Fox Business promoting this. The New York Post has been promoting this. Drudge had a picture of Hillary in a Halloween witch's hat like, you know, the witch is coming back. The wicked witch of the west. And I think to myself, maybe she's such a villain for the Republicans, they want to beat up on her.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Beat up, really, Juan?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that the thing is, she's been on a book tour with her daughter that coincided right now with this process and the timing of it. So, I think, partly, is that just because she's out there and she's commenting not on the -- the book is about successful women in history and all their great stories --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Which is why she's not in it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But besides her obituary it's not -- she didn't just lose to Trump, she lost to Obama and Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And that is a unique thing. Not everybody can say that. And she doesn't have, as Greg said, people saying, like, OK, stand down. Maybe, perhaps, she's whispering that she still feels like she could beat him. Remember, she thinks she did beat him. She thinks that Facebook got in her way, Russia got in her way. There's no personal responsibility, so she can't move on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, you think so. OK. Jesse, what -- I saw today a poll -- did I miss something?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No, no, no, I said, yeah, I think so.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, yeah, I agree with you. OK. CNN had a poll today, had Biden spiking up now at 34 percent, Warren at 19, Sanders at 16. So Biden is at his highest number since he entered the race, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, that is interesting. But here's the thing, why are donors so worried about Trump winning if all the polls, including this latest one, show Trump losing to Biden and Warren and Bernie? It just tells me that you can't trust these polls over a year out. I mean, they had Dukakis beating Reagan. They have Kerry beating Bush. It's way too early. And Hillary loves that they're talking about her now, because she was kind of wasting away now. I mean, now, people are interested in Hillary. People are excited about the possibility of Hillary getting back in.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Am I wrong to say that conservatives --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I would say the New York Times reported that donors are asking about Hillary getting into the race because they don't think these guys have what it takes. But here's the thing. She did win the popular vote. She could run against Trump's record, and she wouldn't have a problem raising money. But the other thing is she's still crooked, she matches up terribly against Donald Trump, and the rest of the party isn't really behind her. And like Greg said, it's going to be an absolute mess if she jumps in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That'll be great.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What do you think --

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.utterance: So I'm gonna say, I have to agree with Jesse. Shocking that -- she is still crooked because the State Department came out saying no persuasive evidence of systemic deliberate mishandling of classified info regarding her e-mail, and that is just so specific. So what she's ignorant then? What they did come back they said that there were actually hundreds of security violations --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Five hundred and eighty eight.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.utterance: During her tenure. So, either she's completely ignorant and clueless or she's a terrible leader and just has her underlings do her dirty work for her, which is why she didn't win. And, you know, Buttigieg said it best. He said the reason that she lost is because her whole message was, we have to -- don't vote for him because he's bad. But they're doing the exact same thing over and over again with their impeachment and with just trying to discredit everything that President Trump does. They're falling into their same pattern of don't vote for him, only vote for us because it's not him, They're not really putting forth anything great that's gonna move our country forward again. I personally don't think she's running at all. I think this is all just silly. But, you know, she can't endure the thought of having another woman in the front, in the lead. So I think that -- that is why she continues to try to make herself relevant. She's not gonna run again in my opinion. But I think it just kills her that there's so many women in the field right now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: By the way, so something like the USA doctor, the fact the Democrats are saying here's a healthcare plan, Trump has none. Here's -- that doesn't strike you as a Democratic agenda forward looking?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.utterance: Look, everyone has their plan. Whether or not it's actually going to be implement and work in our current society is a completely different thing. I don't care if Elizabeth Warren has a very detailed plan. I think it is nonsense. And I don't think it's gonna work if you implement it in the United States, the latest right now. So, plans mean nothing to me right now. I mean, President Trump had said it himself, I mean, healthcare is complicated.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: All right. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg takes the hot seat in the Nation Capitol. He's facing intense questioning from Democrats in Congress over the political ad controversy and claims of bias. That's next right here on “The Five.”

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Democrats appeared to have a new public enemy for 2020, Facebook's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg. They want him to police the platform more, start censoring political ads including and, especially, from President Trump that they feel could tip the scales in the next election. Democrats going after Zuckerberg today on the Hill.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You plan on doing no fact checking on political ads.

utterances.speaker: MARK ZUCKERBERG, Facebook CEO
utterances.utterance: We do not fact check politicians speech. And the reason for that is that we believe that in a democracy it is important that people can see for themselves what politicians are saying.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: So you won't take down lies or you will take down lies? I think it's just a pretty, simply, yes or no.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Russia interferes with U.S. elections. You admit it that you were caught on your heels. The question is, what has been and what will be done for 2020?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg, we talked a little bit earlier about if you can't beat the president at one thing, then you want to take away his ability --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- to communicate. Look, Republicans have some problems with Facebook as well. He did a grilling from both sides. But this issue about political speech and who should be in charge of policing was --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's also -- to that point about the fact there's a lack of innovation and creation on that side. What a contrast between one person who created something for better or worse that has impacted billions in a phenomenal way, Facebook, and you compare to these Capitol Hill clowns. Ninety percent of these relics need to be briefed on what Facebook is. I've heard Maxine Waters actually thought Facebook was an actual book filled with faces.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Speaking of Maxine, you know, she's there talking about like promoting freedom of speech. This is the extremist who ordered her constituents to mob anyone who might have been sympathetic to Trump. So Facebook isn't the danger here when it comes speech. The growing intensity of the intolerant regressive left is coming from another side, and they're the ones that are beating up people and throwing stuff on politicians. It ain't Facebook or the people who use Facebook or the troll farms that paid a couple of hundred grand.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right. The ads that were paid on Facebook were like the fake bots that have been purged. And, Jesse, they say they have new securities in place to make sure that that doesn't happen again. Do you think it's possible that as things start to shift that Silicon Valley might rethink who they align themselves with and support?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Imagine being a genius, Dana.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't have to.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Tell what it's like.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And being stuck in the room with a bunch of idiots. This is what that's like? This guy is a certified genius and you have a bunch of idiot politicians with no talent and no brain, as Greg said, berating him like they have any idea what's going on. These politicians should be thanking Mr. Zuckerberg. Thank you, Mr. Zuckerberg, for letting me stay in touch with my family. Thank you for creating millions of jobs, billions of dollars of wealth, revolutionizing the way human beings communicate all over the world. But instead, they're lying and they're whining about, oh, you let Republicans lie? We're the only ones that are supposed to be up in a lie. I mean, come on. How absurd is that? And for Meeks to say, you were caught flat footed on Russia interference. Oh, I think the Obama administration was caught flat footed there, not Facebook.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's wrong with flat feet?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I mean, sometimes people would have a high arch.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Dr. Nicole, tell us about that

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.utterance: This is an issue --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Do I need to wear lips?

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.utterance: You should. I mean, I have arches. Here's the thing, I found Maxine Waters to be so snarky with Zuckerberg that I found it just offensive. And this -- she actually said to him, oh, you think you're above the law to Mark Zuckerberg, this genius, and it was just -- I find it very ironic coming from her who had -- I think it was three ethics violations charge brought on her in 2010, subsequently dropped. However, it's just -- I find it -- I find it very despicable the way they've treated this man. Now, you have two different issues when it comes to Facebook, you know, the market power and then his Libra cryptocurrency. You know, I personally have some concerns with the monolithic company with history of security breaches having their own cryptocurrency. However, cryptocurrency is the future. And although, I may not be there quite yet, I can barely even use my iPhone very well, I would love to see a cryptocurrency be this big come out of America as opposed to somewhere else --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: China.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIRE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Juan, do you think the Democrats are going to try to push for regulations to make - try to make Facebook police speech on their platforms or maybe think, do they think that enough public pressure can be brought to bear that they would change their policy?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think Zuckerberg has said that he would like them to do this. That's what he said. That's his statement, Dana. My concern is when I listen to all of you, I think, goodness gracious, we know that Facebook was exploited by the Russians last time. Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They did a terrible job.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We know that the Russians continue to exploit Facebook to divide us by race, by religion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Those are the Democrats, not the Russian.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Come on, Greg. So, in other words, you guys have no problem with that or that politicians are allowed to put lies out, things like that. Pelosi video of her appearing to be drunk when we know it was distorted and wrong, and Nancy Pelosi asked them to take it down. They refused. And yet you guys are like well, no, he's a genius. Well, if he's a genius, he has brought something into us that's like a germ that's been absolutely damaging to our democracy.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Politicians lie all the time. Bernie Sanders--

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's fine.

utterances.speaker: SAPHIER
utterances.utterance: Fact checker.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Then they should not be we - let me just say, so Donald Trump's campaign spent about $2 million to buy 1800 ads on Facebook in September, got 16 to 18. What is it about?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How dare he?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: A distorted version of what he did in terms of violating the Constitution that's led to impeachment. Why are those lies allowed to go out like that? That's wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank God, Liz Warren isn't lying.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And who would police that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. I get the point. All right. Thank you for all of that great discussion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Was it really great?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, really great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I'll give it a few minus.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
